Content.Title: Part-time
Content.BodyCopy:
Part-Time students are considered as matriculated (degree-seeking) students. Part-Time students may take a maximum of 9 credit hours per semester. Applicants may apply to be Part-Time students if they are not enrolled on a track at BYU-Idaho, have not received a Bachelor's degree or higher, and meet any of the following criteria:

  • Married
  • 25 years of age or older
  • Single parent

Academic Requirements

Student applying with less than 24 college credits will need to submit their high school transcripts, ACT/SAT score, and college transcripts if applicable. Students need to meet the minimum academic requirements of a 2.0+ high school GPA and a 16+ ACT/SAT score.

Students transferring with more than 24 college credits need to submit their college transcripts and must have a 2.5+ tranfer GPA. Students must have less than 120 credits to be considered for admission.

Maintaining Enrollment

Part-Time students are required to enroll each semester (excluding Summer Session) with no break. If a student does not enroll in any courses in a semester while on Part-Time status, their admission will be dropped and they will be required to reapply if they desire to come back to BYU-Idaho.

Required Application Materials

  • Part 1 Student Information
  • Part 2 School Selection
  • Part 3 Ecclesiastical Endorsement
  • $35 Application Fee (if applicant has never applied to Ricks College or BYU-Idaho.)

Financial Aid:

Part-Time students may qualify for financial aid if they do not already have a Bachelor's degree. To be considered for financial aid, submit the following to the Admissions Office in addition to the Part-Time application:

  • High School Transcript
  • College Transcripts

You will also need to fill out a FAFSA form, obtainable at the BYU-Idaho Student Financial Aid Office or at their website, www.byui.edu/financialaid. If you have any questions regarding financial aid, contact Student Financial Aid at (208) 496-1600.

Deadlines and Processing:

There are no deadlines for Part-Time applicants; however, class availability is limited. Because acceptance as a Part-Time student is based on available space, admission decisions for Part-Time applicants typically are only given two to three weeks in advance of the requested semester. Students interested in priority registration are encouraged to consider applying for full-time status. Please ensure all application materials are received in the Admissions office at least one week prior to the desired registration date.
